>
>  Hi Gareth,
>
> =
In general, there are two kinds of automation involved
> on any JComponent.=
 They are: (i) automating the
> functionality using API methods and JUnit a=
nd (ii)
> automating the UI with JUnit extensions like JFCUnit
> and Abbot.=

>
> The strategy would be to define the JTable in a test
> method with row=
s and column and start automating the
> features/functionalities of JTable =
in any of the
> aforementioned.
>
> I am not really sure about your exact r=
equirements.
> Please mail me back if you have any specific scenario
> that=
 you want to automate using JUnit.
>
> Thanks and Regards,
> Saldin
